title: How can good politics be applied with our daily lives? - Quora

response.answer_text: For me, politics means to do anything that helps in the growth of targeted people. Ask yourself, you believe in what type of causes? e.g. you believe in Dalit upliftment, women empowerment, elderly care, minority security, etc. Do not chose more than 4 causes because you would not be able to follow more than that. Suppose you chose women empowerment then see that if women in your company are paid equally to men or not. Do they get physical security? Is their toilet facility for them or not? Do they get equal opportunities like men or not ? Suggest ideas for women development to your organization. Stand-up whenever their rights get violated. This would make you a leader of women empowerment. The same strategy is used at higher level by political parties.

Politics in my evolving point of view represents conflicting views and promoted agendas. They are in conflict and if you like Hegel like some do, then there should eventually be a synthesis of these two opposing views. Don’t see that likely. All I see is hostility, shaming, and shameful behavior. Animals get it. They don’t spend their energies in conflict. They spend > 90% of their energy in pro social behavior. They belong to and promote their group. They don’t trigger conflict in an anti social activity. Groups are selected for according to group theory. I’m a fan of Darwin although not a fan of being violently selected against. I’m more a fan of the kings peace. Internal strife is no way to run a company, army, or country, unless of course you want to spend your weekends walking the streets in protest. says a lot. Yellow Vest movement blowback to financial crisis that never ended – RT’s Keiser Report I like RT. A little Russian collusion.

We live in a wonderful yet frustrating country 300million people thru a representative system must agree on policy…the founding fathers set up the perfect form of debate with a free and open source of streaming information. And all of the values were codified into our omnipotent constitution. And further opened up the public square for tee and open gatherings, yet there are many who say “I don’t talk politics” This is the ultimate acquiescence of involvement and participation. Our daily lives should be filled with research and debate on the policies we hold dear….Aristotle would be proud of your “daily life…. Research Debate Vote!!!!!
